title: Consultant (Accounting & Finance SW Product)
job_description:
Our company's product stands as a comprehensive integrated software suite designed for streamlining accounting closure processes. It facilitates the standardization and automation of preparing distinct Financial Reports and Consolidated Financial Reports, encompassing Balance Sheets, Income Statements, Cash Flow Statements, and financial report disclosures.
By leveraging this, enterprises can significantly reduce time and labor expended on Financial Reports preparation, ensuring data accuracy and facilitating seamless retrieval, extraction, and comparison of report data.

As the consultant for this product, you will:
• Gather and comprehend customer needs concerning accounting and financial management, including the consolidation of financial reports for organizations.
• Demonstrate proficiency in analyzing these requirements and suggesting suitable solutions, modeling processes, documenting specifications, and validating information with clients.
• Provide consultation, implementation support, training, and guidance to clients in addressing issues pertaining to financial control and the consolidation of financial reports.
• Gain a deep understanding of and model requirements related to financial control and financial report consolidation to effectively communicate them to application development teams.
requirements:
• Holds a Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Auditing, Finance, or a related field.
• Has crucial auditing experience.
• Is well-versed in Financial Accounting and consolidated financial reporting, with a strong grasp of data logic across accounting, finance, and consolidated financial reporting.
• Brings at least 3 years of experience in finance and accounting.
• Has hands-on experience dealing with financial consolidation issues, including identifying and eliminating revenue and expenses, managing internal debts, deferring and allocating internal profits, consolidating investment capital, handling trade advantages, addressing deferred corporate income tax, managing consolidated financial reporting expenses, and interpreting consolidated financial statements.
• Demonstrates robust analytical skills to accurately understand and convey customer business needs into applications. Proficient in data analysis, document review, survey interpretation with initial users, and workflow assessment to identify processing procedures for addressing business challenges. Strong analytical skills are a plus.
• Actively engages in FPT learning activities and sponsorship, embracing the culture and activities within FCI and FPT Corporation.
• Shows confidence in negotiation and persuasion skills, finding a balance between personal preferences and business requirements, and engaging with various stakeholders to reach mutually beneficial solutions for business operations.
• Possesses excellent communication abilities to comprehend customer requirements, articulate issues logically and clearly, and adeptly model requirements and business processes.
• Proficient in computer skills, Office applications, and using accounting support software and financial control tools.

title: Mechanical Engineer
job_description:
Position: Mechanical Engineer
- Working time: From 8:00AM to 17:00 PM including one-hour lunch break, 6 days per week 
- Working Place: Temporary office: Binh Thanh, HCMC (until Aug, 2024)
Project Site: Phu My 3 Specialized Industrial Park, Ba Ria-Vung Tau Province

 Job Descriptions
General
­ Report to: Project Manager (PM)/ Project Engineer
­ Job Purpose: Plan and confirm the mechanical equipment design and facilities of the plant in accordance with the contract documents, applicable laws, regulations and standards. Assist the procurement and construction works for mechanical equipment and facilities. Assist and/or carry out pre-commissioning and commissioning of mechanical equipment and facilities at site
 Major tasks:
1. Assigned Equipment, Facilities, etc.
a. Static Equipment, etc.
 Pressure vessel, tower and vessel, heat exchanger, tank, steel structure/stage, etc.
b. Rotating Machinery, etc.
Pump, Blower, Agitator etc
c. Package Equipment
Filling system, boiler, air compressor, cooling tower, etc.
2. Monitor and Control Design Engineering Work
a. Monitor and confirm engineering work schedule, document list.
b. Monitor and control the schedule and delivery of vendors.
3. Planning & Design Engineering Work
a. Confirm equipment list.
b. Confirm loading data and reference drawings for equipment foundation design.
c. Confirm equipment specifications and data sheets. Prepare schematic drawings of pressure vessels, heat exchanger, etc. attached to material requisitions for purchasing.
d. With CAD and/or 3D-CAD software, prepare Overall procedure with Site Manager.
e. Prepare material requisitions for purchasing equipment and systems with Project Engineer. Conduct bid analysis (technical, scope of work) of vendors’ quotations. Review vendor documents, fabrication/installation procedures, factory inspection procedures, pre-commissioning/ commissioning procedures, operation manuals etc. 
f. Coordinate fabrication plan with manufacture at engineering, material receiving, fabrication and inspection stage.
g. When so requested, attend the factory inspections, and check such inspection items as quality, performance, dimensions, paint, quantities, etc. Revise material requisitions as necessary and prepare revised design documents for change order adjustments to vendors.
h. Field engineering work at shop and site
i. Coordinate interface with other design group (process, piping, boiler, electrical instrument, civil, building etc.)
4. Matter Worthy of Special Mention
a. This project is a three-company consortium (Engineering: MPS, Civil engineering and construction: Penta-Ocean Construction (POC), and Mechanical equipment/plant electrical equipment: JFEE), we will closely collaborate with partner companies.
b. When the construction stage begins, be involved in construction under the Construction Manager.
requirements:
 Job Requirement
1. Technical Skills
- Science and Engineering Degree in Mechanical Engineering, etc.
- Familiar with international & local code and standard for pressure vessel (ASME Sec.VIII Div.1, TCVN etc.) regulations, standards, etc. applicable to static equipment.
- Experiences in using analysis software, spreadsheet, CAD for pressure vessel, equipment design (PVelite etc).
- Business English Proficiency (Writing, Communication)
2. Competencies
- Productivity: Improve the productivity and efficiency of the work by continuously reviewing the work processes
- Problem solving: Identify problems promptly, analyze possible causes from various angles, develop and execute remedial plans
- Diversity: Acknowledge and accommodate the differences in nationality, race, and religion.
3. Business Experience
- Construction, Plan and Design confirmation experiences of plant equipment and systems (3 years or more)
 Benefits:
- Insurances in accordance with the Labor code;
- Allowance: Transportation allowance, meal allowance, mobile allowance, accommodation allowance (for project site work)
- Daily shuttle bus to project site.
- 13th month salary bonus.
- Personal Accident & Healthcare Insurance will be covered by Employer.

- Working time: From 8:00AM to 17:00PM including one-hour lunch break, 5.5 days per week (half day attendance per week OR fulltime attendance per bi-weekly)

title: Sales Manager Human Nutrition
job_description:
* Our company

Manuchar, headquartered in Antwerp, Belgium is a leading ingredients/chemicals distributor & logistics service provider. We operate in more than 37 emerging markets with our own local logistics assets and people providing ingredients and chemicals, storage, value-added logistics and just-in-time (JIT) deliveries in over 170 locations.

With operations in Phu My and Hai Phong port, Manuchar Vietnam is active in the Human Nutrition, Home & Fabric Care, Crop Nutrition and Mining & Energy industries with supply of industrial chemicals throughout Vietnam and neighboring countries. 

Operating out of the PTS Saigon Office building, the Sales Manager Human Nutrition plays an important role in our Vietnam market development. He/She will focus on the development of our Human Nutrition business segment supported by a global and regional team of dedicated product/sales managers.

* Responsibilities:
• Developing ambitious and clear market development plans that create synergies with our existing portfolio in Vietnam, in Asia and with our global position as a leader in chemical distribution.
• Visiting our customer portfolio on a regular basis and building and expanding a strong network in the market.
• Documenting and reporting market information in a clear and structured manner to country management and regional business development management.
• Designing a balanced portfolio that builds on our strengths as a company with a global procurement network as well as our local logistical strengths. 
• Interfacing daily with other departments to ensure issues are addressed in a timely manner and to provide a first-class service to our customers.
requirements:
* Profile:
• A bachelor’s degree in food science, food processing, human nutrition, or related field preferred.
• 5+ years of relevant working experience in the human nutrition ingredients industry with proven records.
• Experience and ability to work in an international environment, with prior experience in an international trade and supply chain environment being a benefit.
• Eager to learn and acquire knowledge in view of longer-term career prospects.
• Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English and Vietnamese.
• Experience with a trading & distribution company, a food production company or an end-user is a must.
• Highly driven and organized, with an eye for detail and the ability to work under pressure with tight deadlines.
• Outstanding interpersonal skills to ensure an optimal relationship with both internal and external contacts.

* Manuchar offers: 
• A job full of variety with long-term perspectives in an international environment
• International cooperation with motivated & skilled colleagues around the world
• A full-time contract after an initial probation period with competitive compensation

If you are passionate about human nutrition, possess exceptional sales and business development skills, and are ready to take on a challenging role to drive sales growth in the food and beverage industry, we invite you to apply for this exciting opportunity.

Attractive salary package, 13th salary, meal support, phone support

title: B2B Marketing Manager (In-House)
job_description:
We are looking for an experienced Marketing Manager with great project management skill and passion in B2B marketing, inbound marketing, and digital marketing in general. You will be the leader to our dynamic marketing team, together driving outstanding business results for PMAX.

● Marketing strategy & planning:
- Set marketing objectives based on business objectives and align the objectives with BoD.
- Build the overall marketing strategy for PMAX with relevant campaigns and activities throughout the year to achieve marketing objectives.
- Develop your own work plan and manage the work plan of team members following the strategy.

● Content strategy & planning:
- Synthesize insights from the target audience research and combine with the brand positioning to propose strategic content direction for PMAX.
- Develop effective content strategy with detailed pillars and angles to deliver the main communication objective.
- Design detailed implementation plan with audiences, channels, PICs, and timeline.

● Marketing workstreams execution management:
Manage the execution & optimization of all marketing workstreams following the strategic direction at each period of time, including but not limited to the following:
- Event management: Plan and organize events such as workshops and webinars for both the potential clients and the potential employees of PMAX.
- Social media management: Coordinate with content marketing executives to update contents for social channels including Facebook, LinkedIn, and Youtube; reply messages and comments on these channels following PMAX’s process and guidelines. 
- Website management: Coordinate with content marketing executives to update contents for the website, optimize SEO and website performance in general.
- CRM: Design CRM framework & process and implement CRM activities across channels, especially email marketing.
- Others: Implement other marketing activities based on the strategy at each period.

● Report & Analysis:
- Report to the Growth Director and CEO about the effectiveness of the overall marketing performance with insight and plan for further improvement.

● Team leadership & management:
- Build & manage a Marketing team of 4-6 people, including content marketer and general marketer.
- Coach & feedback to develop team members and maximize their ELV.
requirements:
● Qualifications:
Must have:
- At least 2 year experience in Marketing manager or similar positions, managing at least 3 people.
- Having a deep knowledge of B2B Growth Marketing, lead nurturing and having passion to grow further in this career path.
- Understanding of marketing channels, especially Event, Website, Social (Facebook, LinkedIn, and Youtube), and Email.
- Strong problem-solving skill and data-driven mindset.
- Excellent communication skill, especially in the field of advertising and branding.
- Excellent planning, project management and time management skills.
- Experimental mindset with enthusiasm about self-challenging.
- Data-driven mindset with technical expertise to ensure the quality and accuracy of data; process, design, and present it in ways to map out customers’ insights in order to help the organization make better decisions.

Good to have:
- Experiences in marketing agency or having knowledge of marketing agency business.
- Experiences in building up and managing CRM for B2B business.
- Creative and innovation mindset with interest in working in a start-up environment.
- Ambitious with aggressive targets.

● Benefits:
- Competitive salary range with quarterly & yearly incentives and 13th-month salary
- Flexible working time with 4 days working from home per month and 15 paid leaves per year
- Insurance as full salary (SHUI)
- Annual health check-up and Healthcare Insurance PTI for all employees
- Laptop supply/allowance or support for laptop purchase costs on an individual basis
- Internal training & career development opportunities, and external L&D budget sponsorship
- Team bonding budget quarterly, snack time to engage team members
- Quarterly, Yearly Recognition Gifts & Awards and gifts on special occasions (birthday, New year…)
- Holiday activities; Company trip; Year End Party; Company Birthday; Culture Day; Quarterly Town Hall.
- Other staff welfare allowances.

Key responsibilities:

Merchandising Executive is responsible for the assigned Category’s total Sales & GP, retail merchandise performance, visual and operational presentation of designed selling zones at AEON stores, including but not limited to Layout, Planogram, Schematics, POSM display….

1. Main duties:

- Make the Strategy of Category-in-charge, mainly Beauty care: Product concept, 3C Analysis, Assortment plan, Monthly & Quarterly Sales plan…

- Maintain the data for Analysis and keep updated with Market Trend of product/category, Competitor benchmark…

- Always propose Innovative Ideas, New Product Development, New Proposal to support Business development.

- Deal with suppliers on Price, Trade Terms, Promotion Plan to get the best offer.

- Prepare Planogram / Schematic plan for product display and coordinate with OPR to ensure well-maintained selling floor.

- Prepare Layout, Fixture for New Store Opening (NSO) / Store Renovation

- Do Weekly Market & Competitor survey with Managers & Assistant to MD and make report accordingly.

- Coordinate activities with other departments of the company.

- Other tasks might be assigned by superiors.

2. Rules and Regulations

- Follow all working procedures, the company’s policies, rules and regulations.

- At least from College degree in Economic, business administration or equivalent qualifications.

- 02-year experience in related Retail business with the same categories or department or 1 year at same position at H&B, Cosmetic store is Preferable.

- Show the passion of the Merchandising career.

- Customer-focused/ Customer Oriented mindset.

- Abilities to use Computer, Office programs and Database.

- Strong communication and negotiation skills.

- Self-disciplined with ability to work independently and under pressure.

- Must have Analytical ability and good in data/figures.

- English skills: communication

title: Production Manager (Automotive - Vinh Phuc)
job_description:
Plan, organize, and oversee the day-to-day operations of the production floor to ensure smooth and efficient manufacturing processes.
Manage production schedules, capacity planning, and resource allocation to meet production targets and customer demand.
Monitor production metrics, such as yield, cycle time, and efficiency, and implement corrective actions as needed to optimize performance.
Lead and supervise a team of production supervisors, technicians, and operators, providing guidance, training, and support to ensure adherence to quality and safety standards.
Implement and enforce standard operating procedures (SOPs), work instructions, and safety protocols to maintain a safe and compliant work environment.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including Engineering, Quality Assurance, and Supply Chain, to resolve production issues, implement process improvements, and introduce new products or technologies.
Drive continuous improvement initiatives, such as lean manufacturing, Six Sigma, and Kaizen, to streamline processes, reduce waste, and improve overall efficiency.
Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements, quality standards, and company policies throughout the production process.
Manage inventory levels and material flow to support production requirements and minimize stockouts or excess inventory.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with suppliers, vendors, and subcontractors to ensure timely delivery of materials and components.
requirements:
Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Manufacturing, Operations Management, or a related field; Master's degree preferred.
Minimum of 5 years of experience in production management roles within the automotive manufacturing industry.
Strong knowledge of manufacturing processes, production planning, and inventory management principles.
Proven leadership and team management skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire cross-functional teams.
Excellent problem-solving and decision-making skills, with the ability to troubleshoot production issues and implement effective solutions.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with internal and external stakeholders.
Knowledge of regulatory requirements and quality standards applicable to the automotive industry.

13th monthly salary, Performance Bonus

title: QC Head
job_description:
1) Quality Management
• To train, audit, monitor, manage and lead the laboratory with a close control of procedures for quality control of all products (following Company’s Quality management System): A/C 60/70, Polymer Modified Bitumen, bitumen emulsion, cold mix, industrial bitumen and other specialty bituminous products… in compliance with both the internationals standards (ASTM, AASHTO, EN, ISO etc) and the Standard Specifications promulgated by the Ministry of Transport in Vietnam. 
• To ensure that ADCo operations (bitumen handling/storage/delivery, production of manufactured products such as PMB, Emulsion cold mixes etc) are performed in compliance with the quality procedure and standards applied by the Company Quality Management System.
• To establish and/or maintain high standards in terms of laboratory management (Traceability, reliability, consistency, accuracy) for the laboratory according to Company Quality Policy and QMS.
• To communicate and collaborate with operations department in case of quality issues and to implement and follow-up corrective actions related to these issues.
• To review and certify test reports provided by the lab technicians and maintain the record of all documents as per QMS requirements.

2) Lab Management
• To maintain high level of HSE awareness among the laboratories and ensure that all the staff has a permanent and easy access to the required PPEs
• To maintain the lab facilities in good HSE condition
• To establish and maintain a detailed inventory for Lab equipment, Accessories and PPEs
• To Manage the sue of consumables and chemicals in the laboratory
• To Monitor and review Lab/Staff Expenses and follow uqup on the execution of CAPEX investments provided by the Top Management
• To Create/Maintain a good collaboration with Vietnamese public authorities and technical entities (external laboratories, universities, R&D centres etc)
• To be responsible for monitoring, managing and supervising QC staffs (i.e lab technicians, Lab helpers) 
• To ensure enough resources (equipment, accessories, chemicals) to perform the test as per Company QMS

3) Reporting:
• To provide daily, weekly and Monthly activity reports as per BOM requirements

4) Other tasks
• To provide technical support and assistance to the Company’s customers, contractors, consultants regarding the products mentioned above if required by the technical service team.
requirements:
Skills and Knowledge: 
- Experts in quality control of bituminous products
- Road construction techniques and construction materials knowledge
- Management and Leadership skills
- Fluent in English and Computer literacy
- Good communication & presentation skills
- Decision making /time management & problem solving skills
- Positive Thinking, passionate & self-motivated
benefits:
Thưởng
13th month salary, Year end bonus (2019 & 2020: average 3 - 4 month salary)

Giải thưởng
Annual salary increment, teambuilding, gifts on public holidays, Christmas Day off

job_description:
- Lãnh Đạo và Quản Lý Đội Nhóm: Chịu trách nhiệm lãnh đạo và quản lý đội ngũ nhân viên chăm sóc khách hàng, đảm bảo hiệu suất làm việc và mục tiêu kinh doanh được đạt được.

- Tư Vấn và Hỗ Trợ Khách Hàng: Hướng dẫn và hỗ trợ nhân viên trong việc tư vấn và giải quyết các vấn đề của khách hàng thông qua điện thoại (Telesales), bao gồm thu nhận và quản lý khiếu nại, xử lý yêu cầu/thắc mắc, và cung cấp thông tin về sản phẩm/dịch vụ của công ty.

- Xây Dựng Mối Quan Hệ và Quảng Bá: Xây dựng và duy trì mối quan hệ với khách hàng, đồng thời quảng bá các chương trình khuyến mãi và gói dịch vụ ưu đãi của công ty tới khách hàng.

- Quản Lý Thời Gian và Luồng Công Việc: Đảm bảo thời gian làm việc của đội từ 21:00 tối đến 6:00 sáng, thứ Hai đến thứ Sáu hàng tuần được tổ chức hiệu quả và công việc được hoàn thành đúng hạn.

- Đảm Bảo Chất Lượng và Phản Hồi Khách Hàng: Đảm bảo các yêu cầu của khách hàng được thực hiện và phản hồi nhanh chóng, đầy đủ, chính xác, đồng thời đảm bảo chất lượng dịch vụ đáp ứng các tiêu chuẩn công ty.
requirements:
- Nam/Nữ từ 28-35 tuổi, có kinh nghiệm trên 5 năm.

- Trình độ: Cao đẳng trở lên.

- Thạo tiếng Anh và tiếng Việt, có chứng chỉ Ielts là một lợi thế.Kỹ năng giao tiếp, thuyết phục và giải quyết vấn đề tốt. Có kinh nghiệm làm chăm sóc khách hàng, Callcenter trong lĩnh vực Bảo Hiểm hoặc Ngân Hàng.

- Tính chất công việc:

Vì công ty làm theo giờ bên Mỹ nên thời gian làm việc như sau:

- Thời gian làm việc từ : 21:00 tối đến 6:00 sáng (có 2 tiếng để nghỉ ngơi giữa giờ)

- Làm việc từ thứ Hai đến thứ Sáu hàng tuần (Thứ bảy, Chủ Nhật nghỉ).


** Quyền lợi

- Lương thử việc: 15tr (Thử việc 2 tháng)

- Lương chính thức: 20tr (Tham gia BHXH, công đoàn)

- Thanh toán lương 1 tháng 2 lần (ngày 04 và ngày 19 Dương Lịch hàng tháng)

- Luôn có cơ hội học hỏi thăng tiến trong công việc, nghề nghiệp.

- Được làm việc trong môi trường năng động, linh hoạt.

- Tăng lương tương xứng theo năng lực .

- Tăng lương toàn bộ nhân viên làm việc trên 12 tháng mỗi năm 1 lần từ 7 - 10%.

- Được đào tạo để đáp ứng yêu cầu công việc.

- Được Tham gia đầy đủ BHXH, BHYT, BHTN.

- Được công ty đóng BHXH dựa trên mức lương ký hợp đồng lao động.

- Được công ty chuẩn bị đồ ăn nhẹ sẵn trong văn phòng như trà, cafe, nước ngọt, sữa chua, các loại bánh, kẹo, mì tôm, phở gói, miến, cháo ...

- Có sẵn lò vi sóng để hâm nóng đồ ăn.

- Được trang bị đầy đủ trang thiết bị để phục vụ cho công việc như máy tính, tai nghe, áo đồng phục, dép, ly uống nước ….
